Detailed Description

Reads typed data from a file in the file system.

Typically, this stream has been written by a DataOutputStream. Types that can be read include byte, 16-bit short, 32-bit int, 32-bit float, 64-bit long, 64-bit double, byte strings.

The following example demonstrates how to use this DataInputStream class.

 MyPage::onInit(Persistence* const savedInstanceState) {
           // new Content instance
     gaia::core::Context* context =  new gaia::core::Context(this);

     gaia::base::String fileName("file.txt");
     // Read a file from /data/data/PackageName/files/file.txt.
     gaia::storage::FileInputStream* fis = context->openFileInput(fileName);
     // Wrap a FileInputStream for reading big-endian typed data from it.
     gaia::storage::DataInputStream* dis = new gaia::storage::DataInputStream(*fis);

     int count = dis->readInt();
     for (int i = 0; i < count; i++) {
         int visits = dis->readInt();
         int64_t date = dis->readLong();
         gaia::base::String title = dis->readUTF();
         gaia::base::String webaddress = dis->readUTF().trim();
         // ...
     }
     dis->close();
     fis->close();
 }

See the sample given above. It reads a file from /data/data/PackageName/files/file.txt. And for reading big-endian typed data, it wraps a FileInputStream into DataInputStream.

See also:
DataOutputStream

Definition at line 58 of file DataInputStream.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

gaia::storage::DataInputStream::DataInputStream ( const storage::InputStream &  in) [explicit]

Constructs a new DataInputStream on the InputStream in.

All reads are then filtered through this stream. Note that data read by this stream is not in a human readable format and was most likely created by a DataOutputStream.

Warning: passing a null source creates an invalid DataInputStream. All operations on such a stream will fail.

Parameters:
inthe source FileInputStream the filter reads from.
See also:
DataOutputStream

Reads bytes from this stream into the byte array.

Returns the number of bytes that have been read.

Parameters:
bufferthe buffer to read bytes into.
Returns:
the number of bytes that have been read or -1 if the end of the stream has been reached.

Reimplemented from gaia::storage::InputStream.

int32_t gaia::storage::DataInputStream::read ( const base::ByteArray &  buffer,
int32_t  offset,
int32_t  length 
) [virtual]

Reads at most length bytes from this stream and stores them in the byte array buffer starting at offset.

Returns the number of bytes that have been read or -1 if no bytes have been read and the end of the stream has been reached.

Parameters:
bufferthe byte array in which to store the bytes read.
offsetthe initial position in buffer to store the bytes read from this stream.
lengththe maximum number of bytes to store in buffer.
Returns:
the number of bytes that have been read or -1 if the end of the stream has been reached.
See also:
DataOutputStream::write(const base::ByteArray&)

void gaia::storage::DataInputStream::readFully ( const base::ByteArray &  buffer)

Reads bytes from this stream into the byte array buffer.

This method will block until buffer.length number of bytes have been read.

Parameters:
bufferto read bytes into.
void gaia::storage::DataInputStream::readFully ( const base::ByteArray &  buffer,
int32_t  offset,
int32_t  length 
)

Reads length bytes from this stream and stores them in the byte array buffer starting at offset.

This method blocks until length bytes have been read. If length is zero, then this method returns without reading any bytes.

Parameters:
bufferthe byte array into which the data is read.
offsetthe offset in buffer from where to store the bytes read.
lengththe maximum number of bytes to read.
int32_t gaia::storage::DataInputStream::readInt ( )

Reads a 32-bit integer value from this stream.

Returns:
the next int value from the source stream.
base::String* gaia::storage::DataInputStream::readLineN ( )

Returns a string that contains the next line of text available from the source stream.

A line is represented by zero or more characters followed by '\n', '\r', "\r\n" or the end of the stream. The string does not include the newline sequence.

Returns:
the contents of the line or null if no characters were read before the end of the source stream has been reached. When the line is a blank line, it will return empty string.

base::String gaia::storage::DataInputStream::readUTF ( )

Reads an string encoded in modified UTF-8 from this stream.

Returns:
the next MUTF-8 encoded string read from the source stream.
int32_t gaia::storage::DataInputStream::skipBytes ( int32_t  count)

Skips count number of bytes in this stream.

Subsequent read()s will not return these bytes unless reset() is used.

Parameters:
countthe number of bytes to skip.
Returns:
the number of bytes actually skipped.
